citation.article-title: Streptococcus shiloi and Streptococcus difficile: two new streptococcal species causing a menningoencephalitis in fish.

p.s: Streptococcus shiloi (named after the late Professor Moshe Shilo, who was one of the most prominent microbiologists in Israel)
Ceils are Gram-positive cocci arranged in pairs and chains with a certain polymorphism reflecting variability in diameter.
Ribose, mannose, esculine, cellobiose, glycogen, gentibiose, mannitol, arbutine, salicine, trehalose, melezitose, and starch are acidified (Table 2).
Growth is inhibited in the presence of 6.5% NaCl and in the presence of 40% bile salts, but not at pH 9.6.
Colonies on BHI agar plates are about 1 mm in diameter after 24 h incubation at 30°C under aerobic conditions.
Hydrogen peroxide is not produced in the presence of heated blood.
The type strain ND 2-16 (CIP 103769) was isolated from the brain of a Tilapia.
